To do this notice the pattern of the colored boxes. For example the top row might repeat every 4th row (or 5 rows or whatever the number of rows is before it repeats).  Once you've figured out the pattern just fill in the black boxes with the correct colored boxes. In the end you should see repeating patterns of colored boxes and there should be no black boxes in the grid.

description.description_output: To make the output, you have to... resize the output grid to be double the width and height of the input grid. Then, copy and paste each colored square in the input grid 4 times -- once in each "quadrant" (if, in the input, the square is in the uppermost and leftmost corner, then it should be in the uppermost and leftmost corner in the output, as well as in the uppermost and leftmost corner of each "quadrant"). Then, for every single colored square, do the following: put a light blue square on each adjacent corner, forming a cross with 4 light-blue squares and the colored square in the middle.

description.description_input: In the input, you should see...a figure on a big grid.
description.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...3 up and 6 to the sides.
description.description_output: To make the output, you have to...copy the figure two times in that grid size.

description.description_input: In the input, you should see...a figure on a big grid
description.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...3 up and 6 to the sides
description.description_output: To make the output, you have to...copy the figure two times in that grid size.

description.description_input: In the input, you should see...a black background.
description.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...is the same as the input.
description.description_output: To make the output, you have to...make a green "spiral." Begin in the upper left corner and work clockwise around the outer edges of the grid. Turn clockwise one cell short of making a complete border of green. Continue coloring green until you reach the center of the grid.

description.description_input: In the input, you should see...9 black boxes, with varying amounts of colored boxes inside of them
description.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...is the same as the input grid size
description.description_output: To make the output, you have to...count the number of small colored boxes within the bigger black boxes, the one(s) with the most colored boxes get filled in entirely with that color. The remaining boxes are all black

description.description_input: In the input, you should see...9 black boxes with colored blocks inside them
description.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...is the same as the input grid size
description.description_output: To make the output, you have to...find the black box or boxes with the highest number of colored blocks in the input grid. The corresponding box or boxes in the output grid should be colored entirely that color. The rest of the boxes should be all black

description.description_input: In the input, you should see...5x11 grid
description.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...stays the same
description.description_output: To make the output, you have to...add four more blocks of the same color to the right of the block on the left side of the grid. Add a gray block. Then add four blocks of the same color of the block on the right side of the grid to connect the line.

description.description_input: In the input, you should see...black square areas on multi-color squares.
description.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...is the same.
description.description_output: To make the output, you have to...replace the black squares with the correct corresponding colors, using the blocks without black areas as reference.

description.description_input: In the input, you should see...fill with create colors
description.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...same size
description.description_output: To make the output, you have to...fill with bottom

description.description_input: In the input, you should see...an object on a black background with red blocks.
description.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...stays the same.
description.description_output: To make the output, you have to...change the background to green. The object should have 2 colors red and some other color. From the input, take the color that is not red and copy it exactly as it is. You want to make another copy of that color but make it a mirrored image in the direction of the red block.

description.description_input: In the input, you should see...two different colors of squares around the edges of the grid.
description.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...stays the same.
description.description_output: To make the output, you have to...Copy the input grid into the output. Around the outside of the grid, you will notice some squares are only one square deep around. Take note of these squares. Using green, draw straight lines horizontally and vertically from these squares that are only one deep around the outside, connecting them ONLY to squares on the other side of the grid that also are only one square deep.

description.description_input: In the input, you should see...a pattern with a central square and colored dots.
description.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...is the same as input
description.description_output: To make the output, you have to...If the dots could connect to the central square with a straight line, connect it with the same color as the dot

description.description_input: In the input, you should see... a grid broken up into 4 sections by a cross, where 1 section has an off-color single square in it.
description.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size... is the size of 1 of the 4 sections.
description.description_output: To make the output, you have to... "zoom in" on the section with an off-color square.

description.description_input: In the input, you should see...a grid broken into 4 sections or quadrants, where exactly one quadrant contains a square that is a different color from the other squares.
description.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...is the size of one of the quadrants.
description.description_output: To make the output, you have to...select the quadrant with the different colored square, then copy and paste the quadrant as the output.

description.description_input: In the input, you should see...red and green dots
description.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...is the same as the old one
description.description_output: To make the output, you have to...use green line to connect the red and green parts in straight lines

description.description_input: In the input, you should see...a pattern of colored blocks repeated several times from left to right in the grid.
description.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size... is the size of one example of the colored block pattern.
description.description_output: To make the output, you have to...zoom in on one example of the colored pattern and paste it into the grid of the correct size.

description.description_input: In the input, you should see... A repeating pattern (usually repeats three times)
description.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size... should be set to the equivalent grid size that the singular pattern takes up
description.description_output: To make the output, you have to... fill the grid up with the singular identified pattern

description.description_input: In the input, you should see...large grid with many colored blocks.
description.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...same as the input.
description.description_output: To make the output, you have to....make the entire output black. Then, you need to locate a block that is the only color in the input and place it in the same position. Surround the block with red blocks until it forms a square.

description.description_input: In the input, you should see...a black grid with four different structures. Three are the same color and one is multi-colored.
description.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...stays the same.
description.description_output: To make the output, you have to...change the colors of all the single-colored structures to the multi-colors. Then change the original multi-colored structure to all black.

description.description_input: In the input, you should see... a black grid with patterns placed thought it. One will be multi-colored, and the others will be a solid color.
description.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size... Remains the same as the input grid.
description.description_output: To make the output, you have to... REPLACE the solid colored patterns with the multi-colored versions, so each pattern has the same coloring. THEN REMOVE the original multi-colored pattern by replacing it entirely with black tiles.

description.description_input: In the input, you should see...light blue, dark blue and black boxes. The light blue boxes represent an incomplete rectangle.
description.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...stays the same.
description.description_output: To make the output, you have to...change the dark blue boxes to green boxes where they cover parts of the rectangle created by the light blue boxes. Once changed the rectangle shape should be clear with no dark blue boxes within its borders.

description.description_input: In the input, you should see... an incomplete rectangle or square
description.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...same as the input size
description.description_output: To make the output, you have to...replace the blue squares with green squares to complete a square of a rectangle with the light blue blocks

description.description_input: In the input, you should see... two blue colored grids on top of the grey grids, a black grid is between the two blue grids
description.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...the two blue grids have been moved two steps downwards
description.description_output: To make the output, you have to...change blue grids to black background, count two steps below each grid's initial placement and fill with blue

description.description_input: In the input, you should see...a large grid with a multicolored pattern. Notice that the pattern is mirrored horizontally and vertically.
description.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...stays the same.
description.description_output: To make the output, you have to...Copy the input grid to the output grid. You will see boxes where the pattern is missing. In these boxes, mirror the pattern from the opposite side of the grid, exactly. Use the same colors.

description.description_input: In the input, you should see...a large multicolored pattern that is symmetrical horizontally and vertically. The pattern has had large shapes placed on the pattern. The large shapes are a different color than the rest of the pattern.
description.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...is the same is the input grid.
description.description_output: To make the output, you have to...replace the large shapes with the mirrored version of what is on the opposite side of the pattern.

description.description_input: In the input, you should see... a pattern on the left, a grey bar and blue squares on the right
description.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size... is the same as the input
description.description_output: To make the output, you have to... copy the pattern on the left and recreate the same pattern over each blue square on the right side, such that the center of the pattern is where the blue square was

description.description_input: In the input, you should see...a color pattern on the left side and blue squares on the right.
description.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...same size as input
description.description_output: To make the output, you have to...use the blue square as the middle square and recreate the same pattern replacing the blue square with the same color in the middle as the pattern

description.description_input: In the input, you should see...a 3x3 multicolored pattern to the left of the grey bar and a number of blue squares to the right of the grey bar
description.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...is the same as the input
description.description_output: To make the output, you have to...copy the pattern on the left of the grey bar and paste it so that it is directly over each blue square such that the center square of the pattern is located exactly where the blue square was

description.description_input: In the input, you should see...Yellow patterns with a single red square on each and one yellow shape with blue and green squares.
description.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...Copy grid size
description.description_output: To make the output, you have to...Repeat pattern shown on single yellow pattern onto others

description.description_input: In the input, you should see... a grid with many squares in one color and a smaller number of squares in red.
description.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size... is the same as the input grid
description.description_output: To make the output, you have to... copy the input grid. Connect the red squares with yellow to create yellow and red rectangles or squares. Only connect red squares that are close together. Do not turn any black squares yellow - only connect red squares that you can connect by making the other color in the grid yellow. The output grid will have more than one yellow and red rectangle or square.

description.description_input: In the input, you should see...a black grid with a blue pattern across the top and red at the bottom
description.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...same as the input
description.description_output: To make the output, you have to...imagine the blue is a vacuum and sucks the red up into the open spaces.  Move all red straight up.

description.description_input: In the input, you should see... a few different kinds of 3x3 shape. Each kind should have a unique shape and color. There may be multiple copies of each kind.
description.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size... is 3x3
description.description_output: To make the output, you have to... count the number of copies of each shape. Zoom in on the shape with the most copies.

description.description_input: In the input, you should see...a grid of pixel lines within the overall grid.
description.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...same as the same
description.description_output: To make the output, you have to...copy the input grid, replicate the main pixel placement within the grid and replicate half at the top right corner.

description.description_input: In the input, you should see...single complete pattern with several other small part of the pattern
description.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...same as the input
description.description_output: To make the output, you have to...complete the small part as the same as the complete pattern .

description.description_input: In the input, you should see...three incomplete squares that are each missing a corner.
description.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...is identical
description.description_output: To make the output, you have to...fill in the missing corners with a blue square.

description.description_input: In the input, you should see...pattern of color squares.
description.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...change to 8x6.
description.description_output: To make the output, you have to...imagine grid is cut in half vertical. Copy pattern to top and below left half. Mirror pattern to right half of grid to top and below.

description.description_input: In the input, you should see...one quarter
description.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...eight by eight
description.description_output: To make the output, you have to...mirror the pattern

description.description_input: In the input, you should see... a colored line on the left side of the grid.
description.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size... is the same as the input grid.
description.description_output: To make the output, you have to... copy the input grid. Fill in all of the squares on the bottom row of the grid with yellow. Then draw a red line diagonal from the black square in the bottom left up to the top right of the grid. Do not change the bottom left color when you draw the yellow and red lines; the yellow and red lines each begin in the second column of the grid.

description.description_input: In the input, you should see...large rectangle shapes.
description.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...is the same as the input grid size.
description.description_output: To make the output, you have to...put black squares in the middle of the rectangle shapes so that the pattern is colored square, black square, colored square, black square and so on in the middle of each rectangle.

description.description_input: In the input, you should see...same colored grids forming a shape or a pattern.
description.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...does not change from the input size.
description.description_output: To make the output, you have to....form multiple holes within the formed shapes, like as windows on an airplane, train or a bus.

description.description_input: In the input, you should see...a square of one color filled with another color
description.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...stays the same as the input grid
description.description_output: To make the output, you have to...inverse the colors used in the original shape then add adjacent 4x2 shapes to the outer square on all four sides in the color of the new center square if it had a 2x2 center in the input, or a 3x1 shape on all four sides if the center had a 1x1 shape

description.description_input: In the input, you should see... a grid of colored pixels.
description.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size... is the same as the input.
description.description_output: To make the output, you have to...  Create the same pattern as the input, just rotated 180 degrees.  Done.

description.description_input: In the input, you should see...a shape of one color surrounded by 4 single squares of another color.
description.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...will be the same size as the inside of the single 4 squares in the input grid.
description.description_output: To make the output, you have to...use the color of the single 4 boxes and replicate the shapes from the input grid.

description.description_input: In the input, you should see...black background, and red blocks and, or green blocks surround by other color blocks.
description.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...stays the same.
description.description_output: To make the output, you have to...copy the input. For the green blocks that have nothing around them, make the same placement of blocks around them as the green block from the input that has blocks around it. If there are red blocks with nothing around them in the end result you want to make them be a mirrored image of the input red block, making the colors around the red block go in the opposite direction in on the horizontal.

description.description_input: In the input, you should see...a few red and green pixels. One green pixel and one red pixel will have other color pixels around them.
description.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...the same size as the input grid.
description.description_output: To make the output, you have to...copy the placement and color of the pixels surrounding the red or green pixels that are not alone to the pixels that are alone. If the pixel is green the placement and color of the surrounding pixels should be the same as the surrounded green pixel. This should be applied to all solo green pixels. The same should be done with the red pixels, but the placement of the surrounding pixels should be mirrored horizontally.

description.description_input: In the input, you should see...a grid with black, blue and gray squares.
description.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...is the same size as the input.
description.description_output: To make the output, you have to...find in the input the biggest square or rectangle that can be created with only black boxes. Then make that box area in the output pink instead of black.

description.description_input: In the input, you should see... A random pattern of grey and light blue tiles
description.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size... changes based on the size of the central pattern in the input grid
description.description_output: To make the output, you have to... IDENTIFY the "central" pattern in the input grid. This is includes the two grey columns with light blue tiles at the top, AND EVERYTHING in-between those two columns. Create an output grid size to match the size of the central pattern, and fill it with that pattern. It's like taking a part of the input grid and enlarging it onto the output grid.

description.description_input: In the input, you should see...two gray lines with blue squares on the top and bottom of each.
description.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size... will only be as big as the gray lines with their blue ends, with all the squares that are in between them. (If you see two gray lines that are 3 squares long, and there is 3 spaces of black space between the two lines, your grid would be 5x5: Make sure to include the blue ends of each gray line in your size calculation.
description.description_output: To make the output, you have to...recreate the position of the black space and any blue squares that are between your gray lines. The four corners of your output will be the blue ends of the gray lines in the input. Make sure that the exact amount of black space between the two lines matches the input, and the placement of any blue squares in the black space also matches the exact location in the input. Your output grid should be no bigger on top/bottom or left/right of the blue squares at the end of each gray line.

description.description_input: In the input, you should see...a black grid with some light blue squares and some gray squares
description.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...is the same size as the four light blue squares that form a quadrant shape of either a rectangle or a square
description.description_output: To make the output, you have to...identify the four light blue squares that form a quadrant shape of either a rectangle or a square and then replicate everything inside that shape using the same light blue, gray and black colors.

description.description_input: In the input, you should see...A random pattern of grey and light blue tiles
description.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...changes based on the size of the central pattern in the input grid
description.description_output: To make the output, you have to...IDENTIFY the "central" pattern in the input grid. This is includes the two grey columns with light blue tiles at the top, AND EVERYTHING in-between those two columns. Create an output grid size to match the size of the central pattern, and fill it with that pattern. It's like taking a part of the input grid and enlarging it onto the output grid.

description.description_input: In the input, you should see...squares of different colors
description.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...same size
description.description_output: To make the output, you have to...connect similar colors with that color.  where they overlap you should use the vertical color

description.description_input: In the input, you should see...squares that have similar colors
description.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...same grid size
description.description_output: To make the output, you have to...join the lines, red with red, green with green and the same with the other colors, lines cross each other but up to down lines are on top.

description.description_input: In the input, you should see...gray rows with some other colored boxes in the grid.
description.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...is the same as the input grid.
description.description_output: To make the output, you have to...first copy the gray rows or columns exactly. Now imagine that the non-gray boxes are attracted to the gray rows like magnets. Move the non-gray boxes until they are touching the gray rows. Now, every box should be touching the gray rows. The last step is to change all of the non-gray boxes to be gray. The final result should be only gray boxes, all of them connected by the original gray rows/columns.

description.description_input: In the input, you should see... one or more 4x4 outline of squares.
description.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...stay the same
description.description_output: To make the output, you have to... Copy the grid. color each of the centers of the outlined squares pink. Continue creating a pink line vertically up and down from this pink center cell. DO NOT color the dark Blue outline. Create a pink horizontal line left and right from the pink center cell. DO NOT color the dark Blue outline. Do this for all outlined squares. you should be done.

description.description_input: In the input, you should see...a black grid with a number of grey boxes
description.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...is the same as input
description.description_output: To make the output, you have to...surround each of the grey boxes with a blue border

description.description_input: In the input, you should see...a black grid with a number of grey boxes
description.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...is the same as the input
description.description_output: To make the output, you have to...surround each grey box with blue

description.description_input: In the input, you should see...a black grid the a number of grey boxes
description.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...is the same as the input
description.description_output: To make the output, you have to...surround each of the grey boxes with a 3x3 blue border

description.description_input: In the input, you should see... various bright colors, shapes, and corners of various size
description.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size... match the biggest square/corner. If you only see two corners, the output grid will always be a square for this.
description.description_output: To make the output, you have to... copy the background color and place all of the shapes in order of size within each other. Square will be in the center, box around that, then corners until all shapes fit exactly in the size of the grid. Keep all shapes their original color.

description.description_input: In the input, you should see...a grid with colored pixels scattered. Some of the pixels are touching other pixels {on sides/or corners} while some are singletons, not touching any pixels
description.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...The output grid size does not change. It is the same as the input
description.description_output: To make the output, you have to...copy the input grid, identify which pixels are connected or touching any other and change background colors of single pixels to the background color or black. Done

description.description_input: In the input, you should see...grids of colored pixels scattered. Some of the pixels are connected. some are alone.
description.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...same as the input
description.description_output: To make the output, you have to...remove all the single pixels

description.description_input: In the input, you should see... s a grid with few colored patterns
description.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...is the same as the input grid size
description.description_output: To make the output, you have to...find the single colored dots that  have not connect with others. you have to remove the dots that is not  connected with others and leave it as black.

description.description_input: In the input, you should see... A grid with colored pixels scattered.  Some of the pixels are touching other pixels (sides and/or corners) and some are singletons, not touching any other pixels.
description.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size... The output is the same size as the input.
description.description_output: To make the output, you have to...  copy the input grid.  Identify which pixels are connected or touching another pixel and which are singletons not touching any other.  Change the color of each singleton pixel to the color of the background. Done.

description.description_input: In the input, you should see... different colored squares
description.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...same size
description.description_output: To make the output, you have to...make black squares in the square

description.description_input: In the input, you should see...colored rectangular shapes on a black background
description.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...is the same as the input grid size
description.description_output: To make the output, you have to...replace all colored blocks inside the rectangular shapes with black so there is only a colored outline of the shapes

description.description_input: In the input, you should see...different color squares with a black background
description.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...stay the same
description.description_output: To make the output, you have to...remove the center of the blocks with black and have a single block wide line for each square.

description.description_input: In the input, you should see...fill single complete grid
description.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...In the input, you should see...fill single complete grid
description.description_output: To make the output, you have to...In the input, you should see...fill single complete grid

description.description_input: In the input, you should see...A grid with 2 square patterns
description.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...is 2x2
description.description_output: To make the output, you have to...fill the entire 2x2 grid with the same color of the biggest square pattern that is in the original.

description.description_input: In the input, you should see...gray objects with the black area inside.
description.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...should be the same as the input
description.description_output: To make the output, you have to...fill the black area within the gray with red if it is a square; otherwise, leave it alone.

description.description_input: In the input, you should see...3x3 grid
description.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...1x1 grid
description.description_output: To make the output, you have to...if input has 3 or 4 red tiles output is orange. if in put has 2, 5, or 6 red tiles output is blue.

description.description_input: In the input, you should see...a 3x3 grid with a 2x2 green square in one corner with a red square
description.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size... is 9x9
description.description_output: To make the output, you have to...make grid 9x9. Note the diagonal that the red square is in in the input. The green square in the diagonal will indicate which corner in the output you should put a 4x4 green square in the output. The red square indicates which corner another 4x4 green square will touch it your new square in the output grid. So you will have two green 4x4 squares touching each other  corner to corner.

description.description_input: In the input, you should see...A pattern with missing color in some squares
description.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...Copy the grid size
description.description_output: To make the output, you have to...Fill in the black squares with red

description.description_input: In the input, you should see...You will see a quadrant with a lot of colored pixels.
description.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...is the quadruple of its original size. If the quadrant is composed of 4x4 pixels, then its size will be 8x8. If it is composed of 2x2 pixels, then its size will be 4x4 pixels...
description.description_output: To make the output, you have to...You have to follow the same pattern, but rotate it 180 degrees clockwise, and copy the result throughout the quadrant until you have final it. Every time you copy the result, you have to keep turn it.

description.description_input: In the input, you should see... A colored cross that divides the grid into 4 smaller grids. In the top left smaller grid you should see a shape.
description.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size... subtract 1 from each side. 4x4 becomes 3x3
description.description_output: To make the output, you have to... Think of the new grid like the old grid with the divider removed. recreate the shape from the smaller top left grid of the input in the same color as the divider from the input. Mirror the shape in each of the remaining three quadrants along the x and y axis. for a total of 4 shapes in the same color. you are done.

description.description_input: In the input, you should see...executive
description.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...assume
description.description_output: To make the output, you have to...share

description.description_input: In the input, you should see...a 10x10 grid with different areas colored. One of those areas includes a grey square.
description.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...is 3x3
description.description_output: To make the output, you have to...repeat the colored area that includes a grey square, but do not include the gray square.

description.description_input: In the input, you should see... a same grid with different areas colored. One of those areas includes a grey square.
description.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size... is 3x3 grid.
description.description_output: To make the output, you have to... repeat the colored area that includes a grey square, but don't include the grey square.

description.description_input: In the input, you should see...a design pattern
description.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size... is similar
description.description_output: To make the output, you have to...correlate the design until you have a pattern on all 4 corners of the cube

description.description_input: In the input, you should see... a black shape with two colored lines on one end
description.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size... is the same as the input grid
description.description_output: To make the output, you have to... copy the input grid and then mirror the colored lines on the other end of the grid.

description.description_input: In the input, you should see... a pattern of two colors on the top of the grid.
description.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size... is the same as the input grid.
description.description_output: To make the output, you have to... mirror the top pattern below.

description.description_input: In the input, you should see...the grid size. The input grid size is the center size for output grid.

description.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...same as input
description.description_output: To make the output, you have to...extend the colored blocks, using their original color, to the right and downward, creating "L" shapes. Then, go up to the next colored block and repeat this process, except when you draw the line downward, stop where it would touch the first color. This will form another inverted "L" shape, on top of the first one. Do this for each colored block.

Then subtract the number of the original orange squares by 1, then draw under the orange bar the new number of squares in BLUE, also beginning with the leftmost square. Repeat until the number of blue squares is 1. Draw that, then you are done.

description.description_input: In the input, you should see...a single red box and a single blue box. You should also see at least one orange box and at least one green box.
description.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...is the same as the input grid size.
description.description_output: To make the output, you have to...create 2 designs using all of the colored boxes in the input grid. One design is focused on the red box and the other one is focused on the blue box.  Both the red box and the blue box will be in their exact same positions in the new grid. First put the red box in the same place as it is in the input grid. Now, look at the green boxes in the input grid and imagine that the green boxes are being pulled toward the red box until they are touching it. So, if there is a green box in the input grid above the red box, place it directly above the red box in the new grid. If there is a green box to the right of the red box in the input side, move it until it is directly to the right of the red box. Do the same for any other green boxes. After you are done, all of the green boxes should be touching the red box which is still in its original location. That design is done. Now use the same exact method for the blue box and surround it with the orange boxes. Think of the blue and red boxes as the centers of flowers and the green and orange boxes as the petals.

description.description_input: In the input, you should see... some single and paired red boxes on a black field
description.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...be the same as the input
description.description_output: To make the output, you have to...surround the paired red boxes with green boxes

description.description_input: In the input, you should see...a dark red background with light blue closed pattern in light blue and line-only pattern in dark blue.
description.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...remains the same.
description.description_output: To make the output, you have to...make all the closed dark blue patterns light blue.

description.description_input: In the input, you should see...red background, blue closed and open patterns
description.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...same as input
description.description_output: To make the output, you have to...change closed patterns to light blue.

description.description_input: In the input, you should see...a number of gray single pixel squares
description.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...stays the same
description.description_output: To make the output, you have to...copy entire image over.  Add single gray pixels diagonally from each corner of the current gray pixels, should create an X.  Add blue pixels above and to the sides of the center original gray pixels, so it's like a plus sign.  You will now have a number of 3x3 squares.  Replace the very center, where the gray pixels were in the original input, with black.

description.description_input: In the input, you should see...different gray squares in the middle
description.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...stays the same
description.description_output: To make the output, you have to...place blue to the top, bottom, left, and right of each gray square, change the gray square to black so it looks like a blue plus sign with a black center, and finally add gray squares on each corner of the plus sign to end up with gray, blue, and black squares that are 3x3

description.description_input: In the input, you should see...gray squares on an all black background.
description.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...stays the same size.
description.description_output: To make the output, you have to...put a blue square to the top, left, right, and bottom of the grey squares. Then turn the grey squares to black. Then on the 4 corners of your blue plus sign, add grey squares. These new squares should be 3x3.

description.description_input: In the input, you should see... two gray squares
description.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...is the same as the input grid
description.description_output: To make the output, you have to... copy the input grid and then make all four corners of the gray squares blue. Fill the rest of the edge of the gray squares with yellow to connect the blue squares. Then fill the inside of each colored square with red.

description.description_input: In the input, you should see...two cubes of different colors
description.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...will not change
description.description_output: To make the output, you have to...make each color in line go toward the center.  Make a black empty space in the center by stop the lines 1 square each before they meet. This should give you 2 black squares in the center. Form a new line on each side with 2 cubes on either side for each color.  Put one more colored cube at the end of these lines to make each color connect. This should make an empty space in the center with a size of 2x3.

description.description_input: In the input, you should see...colored squares positioned into patterns. One "fully formed" pattern will have a uniform color. Differently colored blocks will butt against this first pattern
description.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...stays the same as the input
description.description_output: To make the output, you have to...expand the oddly colored cells into a pattern that mimics and mirrors the original set of cells that form the "fully formed" pattern. The output will have a snowflake appearance or a half or three-quarters of this "snowflake". In other words, 4 different colors bunched together will form a fully symmetrical "snowflake", while 3 will produce a "three-quarters" one. If that makes any sense.

description.description_input: In the input, you should see...a pattern of mostly two colors, plus a small shape of two other colors
description.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...same size
description.description_output: To make the output, you have to...fill in the black squares by alternating the colors of the smaller shape

description.description_input: In the input, you should see...a pattern that needs to be completed
description.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...the same
description.description_output: To make the output, you have to...finish the pattern only on that area

description.description_input: In the input, you should see... a complex pattern of colors with some distinct yellow rectangles
description.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...is the same as the input
description.description_output: To make the output, you have to...remove the yellow rectangles and replace the color to match the existing pattern

description.description_input: In the input, you should see...a complex pattern of colored squares that contains at least 2 distinct yellow rectangles
description.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...is the same as the input
description.description_output: To make the output, you have to...remove the yellow rectangles and replace the all of the yellow squares with the appropriate color in order to create a pattern that is both horizontally and vertically symmetrical

description.description_input: In the input, you should see...a  colored pattern.
description.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size... is the same as input.
description.description_output: To make the output, you have to...create a diagonal line from the top to the sides with the less majority color.

description.description_input: In the input, you should see...a random pattern of pixels
description.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...is the number of colors in the pattern times 3 for both width and height
description.description_output: To make the output, you have to...re-create the same pattern with a single pixel becoming a square with sides of length corresponding to the number of colors in the original pattern.  In other words, simply increase the resolution of the input  by the number of colors it contains.

description.description_input: In the input, you should see...colored block patterns
description.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...either 6x6 or 12x12
description.description_output: To make the output, you have to...double the block patterns 2 times the grid size

description.description_input: In the input, you should see...various colored squares and the rest will be black in a 3x3 grid.
description.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size... will zoom out to either 6x6, 9x9, or 12x12, depending how many colors are used (2 colors would make the output 6x6, 3 colors would be 9x9, etc).
description.description_output: To make the output, you have to... just multiply the size of the output grid as stated in the last sentence, but make sure the colors take up as much space as before (if it's a 9x9 grid, each color square will be 3x3, for instance).

description.description_input: In the input, you should see...a square shape with a smaller square centered inside of the larger square on a black background. The two squares are different colors.
description.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...is the same size as the larger square.
description.description_output: To make the output, you have to...make an output grid that is the same size as the larger square. The size and placement of the smaller inner square should be the same relative to the input grid. The colors of the two squares should be swapped.

description.description_input: In the input, you should see...a square shape with a smaller square centered inside of the larger square on a black background. The two squares are different colors.
description.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...is the size of the larger colored square.
description.description_output: To make the output, you have to...reverse the colors of the original squares, keeping their original dimensions.

description.description_input: In the input, you should see... A large grid with a colored square. Inside that square is a smaller colored square.
description.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...will be the same size as the larger colored square.
description.description_output: To make the output, you have to... copy the colored square pattern, but trade colors. For example: If you have a large blue square with a green center on the input, copy that to make a large green square with a blue center.

description.description_input: In the input, you should see....a square shape with a smaller square centered inside of the larger square on a black background. The squares are different colors.
description.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...is the same size as the larger square.
description.description_output: To make the output, you have to...make an output grid that is the same size as the larger square. The size and placement of the smaller inner square should be the same relative input grid The colors of the two squares should be swapped.

description.description_input: In the input, you should see...several colored objects.
description.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...will be 1x1
description.description_output: To make the output, you have to...fill in the new grid with the color of the object that has a hole in it.

description.description_input: In the input, you should see... several square and rectangle objects
description.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size... is 1x1
description.description_output: To make the output, you have to... copy the color of the object that has a whole in in the middle

description.description_input: In the input, you should see...alternating pairs of yellow blocks going up and down.
description.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...is the same size.
description.description_output: To make the output, you have to...start by changing the first set of two blocks to pink. Then skip two pairs and change the next two pink. Complete this pattern to the end of the grid.

description.description_input: In the input, you should see...two colored line touching
description.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...is the same
description.description_output: To make the output, you have to...make the other color line on top

description.description_input: In the input, you should see... two colored lines intersecting
description.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size... is the same as the input grid
description.description_output: To make the output, you have to... copy the input grid. In the output, change the color where the two lines meet so that the other color line is on top.

description.description_input: In the input, you should see... two colored line touching
description.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size... is the same
description.description_output: To make the output, you have to... make the other color line on top

description.description_input: In the input, you should see... a square and rectangular.
description.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size... stay the same.
description.description_output: To make the output, you have to... fill the inside of both shapes with red leaving a border the same color as original.

description.description_input: In the input, you should see... two gray rectangles.
description.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size... will be the same size as the input grid (10x10).
description.description_output: To make the output, you have to... color in the center of each gray square red, but make sure you leave a 1 square gray border around it (so if it's a 5x5 gray square, you would color a red 3x3 square inside it, leaving a gray border around the red square).

description.description_input: In the input, you should see...a single row that has a certain number of colored boxes with black box(es) at the end.
description.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...the same width as the input grid and the height is exactly 1/2 of the width of the input grid. For example, if the original grid is 8 boxes wide the new grid will be 8x4 (8 wide and 4 tall).
description.description_output: To make the output, you have to...make the top row the same as the row shown in the input grid. Every row that goes down adds one more colored box. So, if the top row has 4 colored boxes, the next row down has 5 and then the next row has 6...etc. This will look like a staircase when you are done. Keep going until the grid is finished.

description.description_input: In the input, you should see...a row with boxes
description.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...the same width as the input, the height is half of that number
description.description_output: To make the output, you have to...The top row is the same as the input.  Add one colored block to the row below that, and two blocks to the row below that, etc etc, until it looks like a staircase

description.description_input: In the input, you should see...a black background with another color
description.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...changes to 3x3
description.description_output: To make the output, you have to...squeeze the color other than black together so that when the section of the color come together the pattern is complete

description.description_input: In the input, you should see... a black background with a foreground color.
description.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size... shrinks to a 3x3 grid.
description.description_output: To make the output, you have to... imagine you are squishing the original grid horizontally and vertically. The colored dots move and overlap on top of the background.

description.description_input: In the input, you should see...grids in the first row with different filled colors
description.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...should be the same
description.description_output: To make the output, you have to...filled the black grid from the third row with the colors specified in the first row. For example, fill the third row with the color in the first row and first column, and repeat.

description.description_input: In the input, you should see...grids in the first row with different filled colors
description.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...should be the same
description.description_output: To make the output, you have to...filled the black grid from the third row with the colors specified in the first row. For example, fill the third row with the color in the first row and first column, and repeat.

description.description_input: In the input, you should see...a color pattern of either 2, 3 or 4 various colors
description.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...is the same size as the input grid.
description.description_output: To make the output, you have to...start on the third row (after the row of gray) and make the entire third row the same as the first color in the first row, then make the entire fourth row the same as the second color in the first row and so on for the next color.  Once all colors have been done, then repeat the same pattern.

description.description_input: In the input, you should see...3 different size of colored grid
description.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...same as input
description.description_output: To make the output, you have to...change the color of center black 2x2 grid to that of 4X4  grid color, 4X4 change to 6X6 color, and 6X6 change to old 2X2 color

description.description_input: In the input, you should see... a series of squares inside of squares
description.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size... is the same as the input
description.description_output: To make the output, you have to... change the color of the center square to the color of the second square, then change the second square to the color of the third square, and continue until you get to the largest square which should take on the color of the input center square

description.description_input: In the input, you should see...3 grids of different colors and size
description.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...the same as the input
description.description_output: To make the output, you have to...change the color of the 6x6 grid to the 2x2 color, the 4x4 change to the 6x6 color and the 2x2 color to the 4x4 color

description.description_input: In the input, you should see... 2 horizontal squares and 2 vertical blue squares.
description.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size... have the same size.
description.description_output: To make the output, you have to... continue the pattern of red squares horizontal and continue the blue squares vertical to reach the edge of the grid. On the square that blue and red squares crosses, color that one yellow.

description.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size... is fully zoomed on the pattern with the highest color count

description.description_input: In the input, you should see...colored grids with different pattern with black background
description.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...fully zoomed size of a certain pattern
description.description_output: To make the output, you have to...fully zoomed pattern of a highest color count among the gird

description.description_input: In the input, you should see... several different colored horizontal line segments.
description.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size... is the same as the input
description.description_output: To make the output, you have to... rearrange the lines from largest at the bottom of the grid to smallest at the top. The final row need not be at the top of the grid. The lines should be aligned to the right side.

description.description_input: In the input, you should see...pixels of different colors joined and placed horizontally on these black grids, separated by black grids
description.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...the same size as the input
description.description_output: To make the output, you have to...place them on each other according to their lengths on the grid right side

description.description_input: In the input, you should see...grey squares.
description.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...the same as the input.
description.description_output: To make the output, you have to...fill the center of the smallest square with pink, the middle square with dark yellow and the biggest square with light blue.

description.description_input: In the input, you should see...gray outlines of squares with holes unfiled or black in color.
description.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...the same as input.
description.description_output: To make the output, you have to...flood fill the holes within the squares, with pink for the smallest, the largest with light blue and the medium sized with orange.

description.description_input: In the input, you should see...many squares and some black squares that run from end to end vertical or horizontal
description.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...has same size
description.description_output: To make the output, you have to...color the black squares that create a line vertical or horizontal all the way across the grid red and only those squares red.

description.description_input: In the input, you should see...a 3x3 grid with all colored boxes.
description.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...needs to be 9x9.
description.description_output: To make the output, you have to...Notice that you can copy the original 3x3 grid 9 times into the new grid (nine 3x3 patterns) and fill out the new grid in this pattern. Now look at which color is the most common in the input grid and keep that in mind. For example, if blue is the most common color in the input box and the top, left box is blue then copy the entire 3x3 box into the top, left 3x3 area in the new grid. If the bottom, middle box is blue then copy the entire 3x3 grid into the middle top of the new grid. Alternatively, suppose the top right box is red (or any other color that is not the most common) in the input grid...then that top right 3x3 area should be black in the new grid. Keep following that pattern until you're done. The black holes should now correlate to the locations of the colors of the boxes (in the input grid) that were not the most common.

description.description_input: In the input, you should see...3x3 grid with a color pattern that will be repeated in output
description.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...enlarged to 9x9
description.description_output: To make the output, you have to...copy the input pattern.  paste in output in a way that's similiar to the most common color in the input.  For instance is green is the most common color and the green boxes are diagonal, this pasted pattern would be diagonal as well

description.description_input: In the input, you should see...diagonal colored lines with black sections in them.
description.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...is the same as the original.
description.description_output: To make the output, you have to...fill in the black squares according to the pattern of diagonal colored squares.

description.description_input: In the input, you should see...a pattern of diagonal lines
description.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...same as original

description.description_output: To make the output, you have to...divide each block  into a 2x2 square in the same color as the original block. So, each block from the original input grid will become a 2x2 block of 4 squares of the same color as the original block.

description.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...is going to be smaller than the original. It will be the same size as the largest shape created by the groups of colored pixels.
description.description_output: To make the output, you have to...place all the groups of pixels on top of each other keeping all colors the same. Leave any left over blocks the color of the original background.

description.description_input: In the input, you should see...blue and yellow colors
description.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...is the same as the input grid size
description.description_output: To make the output, you have to...change the yellow grids into grey one

description.description_input: In the input, you should see...blue grid with yellow grid
description.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...same as  input
description.description_output: To make the output, you have to...replace yellow grid with grey

description.description_input: In the input, you should see...a a small square inside the input grid with border.
description.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...is the same as the small square inside the input grid.
description.description_output: To make the output, you have to...copy the entire small square grid without change in  the pattern or the colors along with the border.

description.description_input: In the input, you should see....one section that has a different color border
description.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size... will be the number of squares within the different color border, including the colored border
description.description_output: To make the output, you have to... count the number of squares in the colored border and resize the output to that number. Then you color all the blocks to match the input.

description.description_input: In the input, you should see... a simple 3x3 pattern of orange and black dots.
description.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size... doubles horizontally, so instead of 3x6 it's now 6x3.
description.description_output: To make the output, you have to... copy the original pattern to the left half of the grid, then mirror it on the right, like an inkblot.

description.description_input: In the input, you should see...an orange shape on a black background
description.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size... has twice as many rows, but the same height
description.description_output: To make the output, you have to...create a left-right mirror of pattern of the orange shape.

description.description_input: In the input, you should see...the orange grid only
description.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...two times the row, but same height!
description.description_output: To make the output, you have to...make the pattern mirror as left-right with the same height and twice the row.

description.description_input: In the input, you should see...a pattern of colored squares and some gray blocks
description.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...is the same as the input grid size

description.description_input: In the input, you should see... A line of colored blocks on the left
description.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...is the same size
description.description_output: To make the output, you have to...color the horizontal blocks the same pattern as the vertical colors

description.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...is 9x9

description.description_input: In the input, you should see...a black background with gray squares
description.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...the same as input grid

description.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size... is the same for input and output
description.description_output: To make the output, you have to... change the gray blocks to blue and the squares that go around it to turn it into a blue block of 9.

description.description_input: In the input, you should see...a long grid with several colors.
description.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size... must be 4x4
description.description_output: To make the output, you have to...consider the long input as two sections as 4x4 grids, consider that the two sections as one.. then the leave that black spaces as black then point the colored blocks as green.

description.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...the size of one of the designs

If there are an even number of squares in the bar, the red squares and light blue squares should be even.  If there are an odd number of squares in a bar, there should be one more upper red squares than there are lower blue squares.

description.description_input: In the input, you should see...a left section with yellow squares.
description.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...is like the left section with the yellow squares.
description.description_output: To make the output, you have to...over lay the dark red and blue areas and fill in the black squares where possible.

description.description_input: In the input, you should see...a pattern with different colored squares
description.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...is the same
description.description_output: To make the output, you have to...wherever you see a color other than black make squares below that color the same color down to the border

description.description_input: In the input, you should see...a blue square.
description.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...is the same size.
description.description_output: To make the output, you have to...use just grey blocks add blocks to the top of the blue box, add two up, and then two to the right. Below the blue box add grey blocks, two down and then two to the left. Repeat this pattern to the edge of the grid.

description.description_input: In the input, you should see...one light blue square
description.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...is the same as the input

Then make three gray squares (total) to the right, then three more (total) going up, etc to the end of the border. Do the same thing going down, except the squares should go to the left instead of to the right. It should look like stairs, sort of.

description.description_input: In the input, you should see...several shapes of one single color
description.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...is the number of shapes the input grid has. for example, if the input grid has 3 shapes, the grid size is should be 3x3

So if the top left has a red square, then a yellow square with a blue square below the red square and a green square below the yellow square, then those would be placed in the corresponding squares on the output grid.

description.description_input: In the input, you should see...patterns in a large area
description.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...will be 2x2
description.description_output: To make the output, you have to...take the pattern on the top left and put it in the 2x2 grid

description.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...is the same as the input.

description.description_input: In the input, you should see...black background with blue squares and red squares.
description.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...is the same as the input grid.
description.description_output: To make the output, you have to... First, copy the input grid and leave it as it is. The blue squares act as a starting point for you to draw lines, so if the blue squares are on the left, you have to draw lines horizontally to the right and if the blue squares are at the top, you have to draw the line vertically down. Next, after copying the grid, draw lines from each blue squares and stop just before the grid with the first red square. Then you will start again to draw your second blue lines starting from the grid with the red square, however, you will have to move your line by one grid according to the position of your red square - if your red square is at the bottom, you will move the second line up by one grid, if your red square is at the right, you will have to move your second line left by one grid and if your red square is at the left, you will have to move your second line to the right by one grid. These second blue lines stop just before the grid with the second red square. You will then draw another set of blue lines with the same rule as the second line all the way to the end of the grid.

description.description_input: In the input, you should see...black background with two grids of the same color and another two grid of a different color
description.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...is the same as the input grid size.
description.description_output: To make the output, you have to...copy the input grid, identify the colors of the colored grids. we will call it color A and color B. Around the grids with color A, create a 3x3 square with color B, surrounding the color A grids. Around the grids with color B, create a 3x3 square with color A, surrounding the color B grids. Now we should have four 3x3 squares, in which two squares are A color with B colored grid in their centers.
